title: Articles with countable and uncountable nouns

exercises.title: Articles With Uncountable And Countable Nouns

questions.question: We are having .......................... weather.
questions.description: Weather is an uncountable noun. We cannot use the articles a/an with it.

questions.question: Have you got ............................ for dry skin?
questions.description: Sometimes uncountable nouns are treated as countable to express the meaning 'a type of'.

questions.question: We have made ............................. progress.
questions.description: Progress is an uncountable noun and it cannot be used with the article a.

questions.question: The applicant should be able to speak ..................
We haven't seen ......................... in days.
questions.description: We use the article 'the' to talk about something unique.

questions.question: How did ....................... first discover fire?
questions.description: The noun 'man' is commonly used to mean 'the human race'. No articles are used in this case.

questions.question: ...................... have their own language and culture.
questions.description: The Irish means all people belonging to Ireland.

questions.question: ............................ are losing hope.
questions.description: The unemployed means all unemployed people.

questions.question: ............................... is quite complicated.
questions.description: No article is used when we talk about the whole of life.

questions.question: I am studying ........................ of Lincoln.
questions.description: We use the article 'the' here because we are talking about one particular life.
